description: Episode of Series "Developmental psychology today". Describes and portrays two major theories of cognitive development: Jean Piaget's developmental stage approach with its emphasis on environmental and maturational factors; and the cognitive, learning or behavioural approach of Jerome Bruner, Jerome Kagan and Sidney Bijou. Also examines Dr Siegfried Engelmann's behaviorist view of intellectual development. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary/teacher levels.
